history.content: I believe the program requires research, no? 4 units of it? In that case it may not be a very good idea. I am in it, and it is not a very big deal. They do not even put honors on the diploma unless you do a thesis I think.

children.subject:
Thanks. 

I've finished CS61ABC, 70, MATH54 already, and I'll take 16B next semester. In this case, shall I apply this semester or next semester? In other words, EECS 16B is in progress this semester or next semester?

history.content:
Students must have lower division major requirements completed or in progress to apply to the EECS Honors Program.

    • For EECS: CS61A/B/C, CS 70, EECS 16A/B
    • For LSCS: Math 1A/B, CS 61A/B/C, CS 70 (or Math 55 if DM in Math), Math 54 or EECS 16A, EECS 16B

If you are taking EECS 16B or any other last lower division major requirement this semester (Fall 2021) that means the class is in progress and you may submit an application to  join the program for Spring 2022. The deadline is approaching, 12/1. 

Visit our application for the application: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/honors

Also, please review the program completion requirements on our website. Students in the program will be required to complete 4 research units.

Students must have lower division major requirements completed or in progress to apply to the EECS Honors Program.

    • For EECS: CS61A/B/C, CS 70, EECS 16A/B
    • For LSCS: Math 1A/B, CS 61A/B/C, CS 70 (or Math 55 if DM in Math), Math 54 or EECS 16A, EECS 16B

If you are taking EECS 16B or any other last lower division major requirement this semester (Fall 2021) that means the class is in progress and you may submit an application to  join the program for Spring 2022. The deadline is approaching, 12/1. 

Visit our application for the application: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/honors

Also, please review the program completion requirements. Students in the program will be required to complete 4 research units.

I'm a sophomore aiming to become a software engineer after graduation. I don't want to do research. In this case, does EECS honor help? Just want to have a honor on my degree to make my parents happy.

Besides, I've finished CS61ABC, 70, MATH54 already, and I'll take 16B next semester. In this case, shall I apply this semester or next semester? In other words, EECS 16B is in progress this semester or next semester?
history.subject: EECS honor programs
